p.draft-comment: This topic should present the structure of the publishing template descriptor and information that can be displayed in it: page templates, tags, preview image and so on.
WH-1448 - The template allows you to copy a set of resources to the output folder.
The preview image should have a recommended size.

section.title: Template Name and Description
section.p: The name of the template is a required information displayed in the transformation scenario dialog for this template.
The template's description is optional and contains additional information for the user.

p.codeblock: <publishing-template> <name>Lorem Ipsum</name> <description>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit</description> ...

section.title: Template Authors
section.p: The template descriptor allows you to specify the list with authors of the template, the people involved in the development of this template. This information might be useful when users have trouble or question about a certain template.
Information about an author include its name, email and organization. The required information is author's name.

section.title: Template Tags
section.p: The template tags represents meta information about a template. This information might be related to a specific colors theme or a layout.
This information is displayed by the user interface to help you to find this template.

section.title: Preview Image
section.p: The template preview image is used by the user interface to help you to select this template. Although this information is not required, it is recommended to specify it.
The image dimension should be 200 x 115 pixels. The supported formats are: JPEG, PNG or GIF.

section.title: HTML Page Templates/HTML Layout Pages
section.p: All the WebHelp HTML files are generated based on the HTML page templates. These pages are stored by default in the WebHelp core resources com.oxygenxml.webhelp.responsive/oxygen-webhelp/page-templates.
If you want to change the structure of these pages (you want to add a new HTML component, move some components in other places) you can specify these pages in a template.
section.codeblock: <publishing-template> ... <webhelp> ... <!-- HTML page templates --> <html-page-templates> <page-template page="main" file="page-templates/wt_index.html"/> <page-template page="search" file="page-templates/wt_search.html"/> <page-template page="topic" file="page-templates/wt_topic.html"/> <page-template page="index-terms" file="page-templates/wt_terms.html"/> </html-page-templates>

p.note: If you want to specify the HTML page templates in a publishing template it is necessarily to specify all of them: topic, search, main page and terms. In other words, you are not allowed to specify only a single HTML page template.

section.title: Template Resources
section.p: A template specifies a set of resources (CSS, JS, fonts) that will be copied to the output folder at the end of the transformation. This resources allows you to customize the generated output.
section.note: The path in the descriptor are relative to the template root folder.
section.p: Th resources that you can specify are:

dlentry.dd: One or more CSS files that will be linked in all generated HTML pages.

dd.note: It is required to have at least a CSS file.

dlentry.dd: Allows you to set a favicon for the WebHelp generated pages. This information is optional.

dd.p: Specifies a path to an image displayed as a logo in the left side of the output header. Optionally, you can associate a target URL to the logo image. When you click the logo image, you will be redirected to this address.
dd.note: The logo information is not required to be specified.

dlentry.dd: Additional to CSS, logo or favicon you can specify one or more set of resources that will be copied to the output folder.

section.title: Transformation Parameters
section.p: You can set one or more WebHelp Transformation parameters in the descriptor.
section.codeblock: <publishing-template> ... <webhelp> ... <parameters> <parameter name="webhelp.show.main.page.toc" value="yes"/> <parameter name="webhelp.top.menu.depth" value="3"/> <parameter name="webhelp.fragment.welcome" value="html-fragment/webhelp.fragment.welcome.html" type="filePath"/> </parameters> </webhelp>

dd.p: The name of the parameter. It may be one of the WebHelp Responsive transformation parameter or a DITA-OT HTML parameter.
dd.note: Please note that is not recommended to have a input/output parameter specified like: dita.input, examples.

dlentry.dd: The value of the parameter. It should be a relative path to the template root folder for file paths parameters.
The type of the parameter: string or filepath. The string value is default.
